ref_text: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
hyp_text: In the United States, Princeton University and in Sweden, Uppsala University are among the oldest universities in the world, founded in 1746 and 1477 respectively. They were both founded by King Charles XII of Sweden. Charles XII was a military genius, but he also had a soft spot for science. He was fascinated by the works of Galileo and Newton, and he wanted to create a university where scientists could do research and share their findings with the world. He also wanted to create a university where students could learn about the latest scientific discoveries and theories. So he founded the University of Uppsala, which became the first university in the world to offer courses in mathematics, physics, chemistry, and biology.
